website_summaries.verdict: One of the best handheld pool vacuums for cleaning above-ground pools.
pros: Features interchangeable brush heads that dig into crusted debris, scrubbing it away as it vacuums
Vacuum is small and lightweight for comfortable use during long cleaning sessions
cons: Brush head size covers a small surface area, requiring a lot of maneuvering for large scale cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Buy this you will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: I have the largest index pool they make, I was very Leary of buying this as I have the automatic vacuume that stays on the bottom of the pool from index. So here is my story, I blew sand back in my pool from my filter by mistake, it has been in there for a year because it just wouldn’t come out, it was a significant amount also. Anyways, I charged this up and decided to give it a go not expecting much. This has 2 attachments , use the one that looks more like a broom and it works amazingly. It actually picked up all of the sand and every other tiny thing on the bottom of my pool.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great pool vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to clean up that darn debris that settles at the bottom of my pool. I wish I had bought it as soon as I got my pool, it would have saved me so much extra work. It cleaned the floor of my pool in 20 minutes. Very easy to use, love that it has a rechargeable battery and 2 different brush heads. Worked even better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Rose

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS - IT REALLY WORKS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 100 stars I would!!!! Are you kidding me??? This is over the top fantastic!!!! Cleaned out my 15' X 42" Intex Easy Set pool in about 15 minutes. It picked up dead bugs, pine needles, tree leaves and SAND!!!! I was hoping it would do a little bit, but I was blown away how efficient and EASY it worked!!! The extension pole that comes with it is perfect as well. I'm under 5' tall, and I could reach every bit of the bottom of the pool with no problem whatsoever. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Southwind

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this when I bought it because of some of the reviews. But I am very satisfied. I've bought 5 other vacuums and they did not work nor did they touch the sand at the bottom. This got out all of the sand and debri. It does fill quickly though but that doesn't bother me. The pic is of the 5th dump. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lorah

customer_reviews.title: Guess Im just screwed after buying this
customer_reviews.text: Return window closed on June 23, 2018 and today (July 1) when plugged in to charge the light didnt indicate it was charging. Left it plugged in for a few minutes and it started running (not in water but sitting on my table). Couldn't turn it off. After a few minutes it stopped. It worked well until it did this but i bought it on May 4. Not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cofer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pool Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I attached this small vacuum to my standard pool wand, for my 40 foot by 20 foot in ground pool. It had been six weeks since I vacuumed the pool in our wooded area. There was all sorts of tree stuff on the bottom. It took me roughly ONE HALF the time to vacuum the bottom, than it would with the hose method. It looks like I will only use the hose vacuum in the spring, and "touch up" the pool every two weeks. The USB charging method is a lot more practical than supplying AA or C batteries. Great little product for the money...
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Cromer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Our pool came with a vacuum but it was a pain to get hooked up to our pump. I did research for a lightweight easy to use vacuum and found this one. Was a little skeptical at first but ordered anyway. Today was the first day I used the vacuum and I wish I would have taken pictures of the before and after! This thing sucks in a good way! little effort is needed, you don't have to get in the pool to clean, quick cleaning (I maybe spent 5-10 minutes cleaning our 18ft pool) light weight, and easy to clean afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Carr

customer_reviews.title: Intex Handheld Rechargeable Pool Vacuum Really Sucks - In a Good Way!
customer_reviews.text: We have an Intex 10' x 30" pool and we live in the desert. Lots of sand, bugs, etc., collect in the pool, even with a cover. I wanted something that didn't need to be plugged in or require that we disconnect the filter in order to vacuum. This Intex rechargeable vacuum fits the bill perfectly. It works for about 40 minutes between charges, which means we can clean our small pool 5-6 times before having to charge it. It's easy to clean; just open the dirt cup and dump. So far, it's sucking up everything that the desert throws at it, from sand to beetles.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lightweight, hassle-free
customer_reviews.text: We have a 14’ above-ground pool, and the vacuum works well for our little pool. I like that it does not need to be hooked up to a hose. Just charge it, put it underwater, and go. Our neighborhood has a bunch of crepe myrtle trees so the little flower petals and seed bits wind up in the pool. The petals float, but the seed pods sink. This vacuum did a great job of cleaning them up. The net inside is small, but it gets the job done. Definitely can’t complain for the price. You’ll still need a net for large debris, but this is great for the small stuff stuck on the bottom of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small pools.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by two friends who have pools. I used it in one of their pools myself and I was happy. Mine arrived yesterday from Amazon. After an 8 hour charge I tried it out. We have a small summer waves quickset pool. I cleaned the bottom of the pool within minutes. Since the surface skimmer I ordered has not arrived yet, I flipped the vacuum upside down and cleaned all the bugs from the surface. If the battery lasts as long as they say it does, I should be able to clean the whole pool 5-6 times on a charge. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Gardner

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT. YOU WONT REGRET IT. Life changer lol
customer_reviews.text: Hands down a must have for hot tub owners. We have very hard water and scale formation has been a problem for us. NOT ANYMORE. Not only does this things suck up debris, its vaccume head comes with execellant scrubbing Brissels on the end. Ita also small enough to get those hard to reach areas. This is perfect. No hoses it just runs on a USB charged battery. Easy to empty the filter and it also comes with a micro filter for sand and such. Works wonderfully. Cant believe I have been cleaning the hot tub with out this.
customer_reviews.author: Falesha Jordan

customer_reviews.title: turn it on and its like using a lightweight floor vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! For 4 years I drug the pool vacuum hose out, inserted into the scupper, vacuumed and subsequently shut down the pool motor, clean the pre-screen and cartridge filter, all of which took about 2 hours. Now, it only takes me 30-45 minutes depending on the volume of debris. All I do is submerge it, turn it on and its like using a lightweight floor vacuum. It IS best to stop periodically and empty the filter (saves battery life and better for the motor) but that is super easy. I compared this one to another highly rated vacuum but the number of 5 stars was higher on this one. Buy it, buy it, BUY IT, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Does not vacuum sand
customer_reviews.text: The sand attachment is a small white cloth bag that you have to insert into the other catcher and there is no way to keep it open to catch the sand. When you do fold over the cloth it does not allow the head to fit on the motor securely. When you do manage to get it to stay, you have to take it off and empty it every few minutes. This does NOT vacuum sand efficiently. It does vacuum the leaves with the other attachment, but again, you have to empty it constantly and most of the time the leaves get stuck because the throughout it so small. Ugh!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcgowin

customer_reviews.title: would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review this until having this a little while. Its been about a month now and its still fabulous. Our problem is dirt and flying ant things. And it sucks those both us well. I will say if I have to find a fault with it, its that it fills up the filter neat thing really fast. But for a small pool this is perfect. and the price is great compared to others. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a small vacuum just for a little extra cleaning help.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK and not really worth the money spent on it
customer_reviews.text: I have a Intex Prism pool 15ft in diameter and 48in deep. The great thing about this vacuum is that it is wireless, you just simply charge it. It is also extremely easy to operate. The negative things I have is the suction and the amount of time I spent cleaning it. This have very poor suction power. You have to move it over the bottom of the pool very slowly in the area you are trying to clean. So it is extremely time consuming. It is better than using a brush but no by much.
customer_reviews.author: NoeyK

customer_reviews.title: Works well, once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find this, it seems there aren't a lot out there. The instructions aren't very helpful. It took me a few tries to figure it out (I almost sent it back), now it's working wonderfully. Use the white filter sock and broom type attachment, and empty filter very frequently, and it'll work great. The vents must be under water for it to work, which is important for people like me who are using it in smaller pools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was good but broke within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum was much better than the manual option I tried. I used to to clean a small (4'x4'x8") pool under a fountain. However, once wet, the power button did not slide easily and after a couple years (used maybe once every other month) it broke off. Now it is useless b/c I can't turn it on or off. Also, I only used it with the sand filter in place and it was really hard to get the filter and cover properly back in place after cleaning. Otherwise, the suction was pretty good and I was able to clean the little pool nicely.
customer_reviews.author: da-cam

customer_reviews.title: If you have to remove pixie dust I guess..
customer_reviews.text: If you want or have a need to remove pixie dust at the bottom of your pool then this is probably what you are looking for! I give it one star because it did turn on. However no charger is a definite no star. This thing sucks and not in the way intended! Vacuum effect feels like eyelashes across your skin! Waste of time and money. Going to see if I can return. Almost anything will be better than this garbage. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. I didn't have a full charge on it yet, but was anxious to give it a try. The pool has been only up for 2 days and this still picked a lot up. It works about the same as one you attach to your hose or pump, but a lot less hassle. Just charge and go. Picture shows how much was picked up with only about 15 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to keep our above ground pool clean with the tiny little debris that gets on the bottom. I have tried different products from local retailers and IF they pick up anything they blow it back into the water. This little vacuum gets it all and keeps it in the bag. The directions are a little brief with regards to putting in the white filter bag in the net filter bag but once you get that figured - and understand you have to clean it regulary...this thing ROCKS! Great value for the price and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t used it yet...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the product yet. I received the first one last week. It has a defective charger. A replacement charger couldn’t be sent so I did a return and reorder. The second one arrived today. The charger is fine however the unit will not charge and there is no water seal over the charging port. Luckily I hadn’t shipped the first until back yet and was able to use the charger from the second unit and have the first unit charging now. I guess we will see if it works once it charges. Not impressed that I had to combine parts from 2 broken units to get one (possibly) working unit.
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for koi pond cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our koi pond and am very pleased with it! The micro filter that it comes with makes getting small particals like sand and bits of algae out perfectly. It still has enough suction power to get the smaller leaves and pea sized rocks that get washed in from the flower bed around it as well. The attachments that it comes with are perfect for all the sides and corners. It’s completly easy to assemble and disassemble for cleaning the vacuum after use and storing. So far the battery has lasted a few hours of cleaning for a couple of days and is still charged. Overall I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and the plastic knob at the top immediately broke off. I still worked and I was happy with it...we used it for 2 months last year. This year it is not only useless but I fear if used by an ignorant person it could be dangerous. The motor only works if its is plugged in, I would hate to see someone get hurt because they stuck a plugged in item in the water. It is now completely useless, and it was only used for 2.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amber wilt

customer_reviews.title: Pool Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews I was a little concerned about the product but I really wanted something that I didn't have to connect to the filters. The first time I used it I was pleasantly surprised how well it worked. I found it had quite good suction that time. Unfortunately that is the only time I found it to work well. I don't know what happened. I have charged it, I have cleaned it out as instructed. But the suction just isn't there. The first time it cleaned leaves, dirt, sand, bugs, and anything else you can imagine. Now it doesn't do any of that. I am disappointed now.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic vacuum for a Spa
customer_reviews.text: This Vacuum works wonders getting small debris off the bottom of the SPA and seats. The SPA's filtration system does a great job of filtering out debris floating in the water and on the surface, however, heaver debris that settles to the bottom remains there. At first, I didn't think it was working, however, it activates under the water and picks up all of the bottom matter the kids bring into the spa. It's rechargeable and holds the charge for a long time. We've haven't charged it all summer. A wonderful vacuum - recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Perrotto

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Catfish
customer_reviews.text: This is less expensive than the Catfish vacuum which I originally purchased and it quit working after one year. The suction on this one is great, it's easy to clean, the head has nice soft bristles so I don't have to worry about it cutting into the vinyl. I can also take the head off and the whole thing fits into where the filter goes and I don't need to use a tiny fish net to get the crud out of that spot. Only complaint is the place where it connects to charge has gotten rusty. Don't know if it's a problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing... Wish I'd gotten it years ago
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24' above ground. I use this for about 5 minutes a day to clean up the very fine debris that settles in the pool overnight. I used to think it was sand particles from my filter but i have since discovered it's airborne. It drive me nuts bc i could vacuum later in the day and by early morning there were these little puddles of dirt. It was a pain to break out the full vacuum thing everyday. I got this and i love it, one of my best purchases. It makes cleaning the pool fun. Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY!!!!!!! Worthless! I charged it for more than a week an went to put it in pool an tried to start it an it never worked. I’m serious..... do not buy! I should have heeded the other negative reviews and not wasted my money! Too bad I have to put down one star to leave this review because it should be negative five stars
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Even picks up scoops of sand!
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old decided it would be lots of fun to dump scoops of sand in the pool! Long story short, we bought a cheap, short pool that we converted to use with a sand pump, only problem we hadn't thought of was there was no way to vacuum the pool without spending lots more on other parts. This vacuum amazed me from the moment I put it in the pool. I probably would have spent an hour trying to get all the sand out with a regular pool vacuum that's operated through the pump. This vacuum had the sand completely removed in minutes! Best part about it, no setting up and struggling with hoses, totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: 3 Boxers and a Baby

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. Bought for my 18x9x52 intex rectangle ultraframe pool because i didnt want to deal with vaccum hoses. It isnt really powerful, but picks up small debris and sand from the bottom of the pool. (We keep ours covered when not using it- so that helps) It is small, so i wouldn't recommend it for bigger pools. Easy to use. My only complaint is it takes 8-10 hrs to charge for up to 45 min of use. Its only been about 2 weeks, so we will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: cupcake_queen

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was skeptical as didn't think it would work well underwater, charge well, last long, etc. But, after probably 6 months of using this, it's great. I have a partially buried 24 X 12 X 4 deep vinyl pool, and use this every day or every other day for 5-10 min. Picks up everything at the bottom of the pool, quick rinse of the internal basket, and have to charge every week or two. Does it's job great. Will definitely be purchasing another one if this one dies, great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Calvin 707

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because while filling our spa we used a spicket we don't normally use, and even though we flushed it, it still put rust chunks and sediment in our spa (well water). Our portable spa doesn't have lines to hook a vacuum to, and I'm too lazy to use anything else, so this seemed like the best option! It works amazingly well! Got all the rust chunks, and even scum and small particles! We are first time hot tub owners so getting the water right is proving to be difficult, but this vacuum is helping! I think the only downfall is it's hard to tell if it's actually working or if it's dead.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, nice long handle, no cords or hoses and using the smaller straight brush it sucks up everything. Use the white filter and note that you have to place it inside the black one and roll the top outside and down below the outside ring. I use my foot bath to swish it out for cleaning. Not necessary to take it of and clean it. I just move the vacuum back and forth in the water. Also as other reviews state the charge indicator light never turns green. It will remain red even when fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Coleen Hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: not happy with this a year later !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing for pools I have a 24 x 52 pool. The pole is long enough to extend way out when outside of pool. It works perfect!! This does not pick up big debree but gets leaves, dirt, bugs etc... I am updating my review one year and a few days later. the vacuum does not charge anymore. and it looks like rust inside of the charger port. how does a pool vacuum get rusted. well im out of a vacuum now. so money down the drain!!! when it works it does work great. we loved it all summer last year. not we try to use it again in 2020 and its no good. very upset
customer_reviews.author: Garcia

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday and charged it overnight...~12 hours. Submerged it for about 2 minutes, turned it on and it wouldn't work. Piece of Junk, would not recommend. Some other comments outside of it being DOA; that 0-1 switch is TERRIBLE, it just flops back and forth without any force applied. Don't waste your time or your money. I can't even return it via home pickup, which is an inconvenience given that this thing was DOA. Amazon should do better.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Best spa vacuum I’ve used!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the first one I ordered, charging base was loose and wouldn’t charge unless I held it the entire time. I needed this ASAP for a fully booked vacation rental seen as our other vacuums quit working. I contacted the seller and they immediately sent out another vacuum and it worked great!! Best vacuum I’ve ever used for our hot tub. Scrub brush made it easy to clean off the filters and pick up all the leaves, dirt, and sand.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work but a few times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last summer for my 24 foot pool. It has a very small opening for debris so it can't pick up large pieces of leaves ect off the bottom of the pool and it fill up quickly. I only used it about 4 times before the winter and stored it indoors throughout the winter and just went to use it for the first time this summer and it won't work. I tried charging it again even though it was fully charged when I put it up for the winter and it won't come off red when plugged up. I'm very disappointed I paid so much to not even get 5 uses out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum and put it into use summer 2017. Used about 6 times. Of note, after using, when you go to plug it back into the charger, there is water in the area of the connection and this rusts over time. It also does not have a very strong suction but patience made it usable. I just went to use it yesterday, it worked, but then would not turn off - the mechanism of the on/off switch had become inoperable. I had to let it run itself dead while underwater. So my review is a one-star because of these things. For the price, it should be made a little better.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Brentlinger

customer_reviews.title: So small!!! Useless!
customer_reviews.text: Tiny! It is NOT for a pool ... won't hold more than 5 leaves! Might be good for picking up dirt in the bottom of a small hot tub. Didn't even bother unpacking and trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 27foot above ground pool. This works great! It picked up everything from small particles of dirt to small leaves. I would definitely recommend this vacuum to anyone with a pool. The only thing that could make this better is if they included a charger head with it. I tried several before I found one that worked!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not last longer than a month
customer_reviews.text: I have had the vacuum for just over a month. It worked GREAT at first. Easy to use, cleaned well, easy to charge. However, after about 6 weeks of use it'll no longer charge. Followed all care directions, charging directions, and didn't over charge it. I wouldn't bother with purchasing this item if you want to use it longer than 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Better just burn your money.
customer_reviews.text: Beware! This vacuum never turned on, I thought it was due to a bad charger (NOT INCLUDED) so I tried and purchased a few of them. Once I gave up charging it and trying to get to run; I wanted to return to find out that: "50% of restocking fee" was going to be applied, I had to cover mailing costs and in case this was rejected another 20% was going to be added. Not worthy to return... I just hate giving my money away like this.
customer_reviews.author: CAROLINA

customer_reviews.title: A LOT less work!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a summer to buy this vacuum, now I wish I had bought it last summer. It is easy to use, easy to charge. No hoses, no hooking up to filter. The charge lasts long enough to get the silt out of our 18 x 52" Intex pool twice! The pool has stayed MUCH cleaner, using the micro filter bag. I have actually drained the pool in the past to get the silt out,-no more of that! This is a great item, saves time and money. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good Suction but very hard to Charge Up!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the suction power and easy use! Just vacuum pool floor as easily as you vacuum your living room floor! No hoses or hookup. Hate the charging cord and cannot get the cord to stay connected!! I returned one and got another. Same Issue!! Now I have to use masking tape to try to get the charger to stay on and even that is dicey. Great vacuum but if it can’t be recharged, what is the point??
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected! Works great
customer_reviews.text: If you have been thinking of getting this, DO IT! It got a whole winters worth of algae growth out of my 15x48 intex pool. Sure it took a while, but worked way better than the other vacs I have that don't hook up to the filter. This is nice because you don't have to whip out the hose, deal with hooking it up to the filter, backwashing, etc. We had all the algae sucked out before we even hooked the filter back up from winterizing. I can tell it's going to be great to have during the season because it's going to be less hassle and easier to vacuum when we notice a trouble spot. Love that it's rechargeable
customer_reviews.author: Marlana M

customer_reviews.title: Remember that you only have a 30 day return policy.  Not nearly enough time.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum cleaner is such a disappointment. It never had great suction power and now it no longer works. It is past the 30 day return policy. This not a vacuum that I needed to use frequently, just when leaves or grass ended up on the bottom of the pool. Thirty days is not a long enough return policy. I have an Intex pool, Intex sand/salt pool filter and I have been extremely satisfied with the Intex brand. This vacuum was a waste of $90.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 5 times now and almost look forward to cleaning out our 12' swim spa. It works completely as advertised. I charged it up when I purchased it and am still using it on that charge. Several other reviewers mentioned having to use the smaller mesh 'micron' bag, but I have not needed to even do that. It is a delight to use, well designed and I highly recommend this purchase. Only quirk is that the charging cord is not a 110V plug in adapter but a USB adapter to the mirco-USB charging socket on the vac. Hey - if that's the biggest issue, I'm still good with a product that does it's job so well.
customer_reviews.author: Sue R.

customer_reviews.title: Just turn it on, put it in and go!
customer_reviews.text: Okay I was sure this was going to disappoint me. The only thing I'm disappointed in was that I didn't buy it sooner! We got this for our little 10' x 3' pool. It's AWESOME! We always keep the fine mesh sock on it because we have a lot of sand around the pool and it gets it up every time. I do wish it had a better indication of Battery level and Charge status (there is NONE of either so it loses a star). But it works so well and is so much easier than trying to hook up a hose and all that mess! Just turn it on, put it in and go!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pool vac. At first, i thought i was going to send it back but then realized i was doing something wrong. It picks up more than u think it would, kept my pool totally clean all summer long. Unfortunately, it gave out just as summer was ending.. Actually, the motor didn't give out, it kept running and running, I could get the switch to slide over to shut it off. They need to improve the switch, it still works but can't shut it off once it's charged. However, for the price, u can't beat it. No fuss with long hoses, makes vacuuming the pool a snap. Will def purchase another for next summer...
customer_reviews.author: Mary from MA

customer_reviews.title: Intex recharegeable pool vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My biggest problems with this device are #1. The charging device is USB powered. This is just wrong. It takes forever to charge and who has a usb power source near their pool. #2. I have owned two different cordless pool vacs in the past. (both pool busters) which are more powerful, have larger brush scrubbing vacuum heads, and last longer. The number two flaw is the tiny brush head size. Just too small and takes too long to clean a 15' pool bottom. Granted the pool busters are more expensive but my 6 yr old unit still outperformes this Intex model.
customer_reviews.author: Xpert1

customer_reviews.title: Small suction head, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely over payed for this item. Originally I could’ve purchased for $85 but did a little research and ended up buying this because it was the most practical and economical for the type of pool I have. When I went back to purchase the item (1-2 weeks later), it cost $145 (I don't think it was the same vendor). It works, but the head is definitely too small. It has to be completely submerged in water to work which is OK. If your pool isn’t too cold!
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have a small intex pool for my kids that was extremely dirty because my filter stinks and I didn't know how else to get the dirt up. I couldn't figure how to make your "own" pool vacuum from the YouTube videos online so I purchased this. This vacuum was more expensive that my pool itself so I was very hesisitant to purchase it. I wasn't sure if it was going to work. I only used it one time so far but this thing works like a charm. My pool was so dirty and now is very clean. You won't go wrong by purchasing it .
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Capacity way too small! Made for a tiny wading pool.
customer_reviews.text: Super small capacity!! The bag that holds the debris is smaller than a fist. Which makes cleaning a pool very tedious because you’ll be constantly emptying the bag. Also there is no charger included just the cord. So I have to find the specific charger that is compatible with this the battery? Also too small to pick up leaves that fall in the pool. Otherwise is does pick up and seems to work well. Just very small debris and if you have very little. ++Update On/Off Switch is now no longer working it is stuck. Only had this for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Clinton II

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's a great buy and very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I am a new pool owner and bought this when I could not figure out how to use the creepy crawly cleaner that was left behind. Even after I figured out how to use that, I still prefer to use this handheld vacuum. It is light and the telescopic handle easily extends to reach about 10ft. I use this once a week as needed in my pool and it's easy to remove the dirt trap net and rinse it. For the price, it's a great buy and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly with my intex purespa. Soft bristles to get into the nooks and crannies. I read a lot of reviews and questions before I decided to make my purchase. I don't remember who said it but the tip they gave about making sure the micro filter was pulled back securely around the rim of the mesh filter was spot on. I can see how the directions didn't make that clear and folks had difficulty with it. Yes the switch seems loose but if you have it in the right position it seems to lock in place once the unit is under water.
customer_reviews.author: V. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small 8ft round 2ft deep stock tank pool (yes, we are one of THOSE people). The flatest spot in our yard is next to trees, so we always have junk on the bottom if the pool. This vacuum works great! It picks up sand, leaves, dirt, bugs, anything that has fallen to the bottom of the pool. My suggestion to make it easierest, is to run the filter for a couple hours, let all the settlement spin to a small pile in the center of the pool and run this vacuum over it a couple times, slowly as to not churn up the water.
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well - Don't let other reviews deter you!
customer_reviews.text: When I read other reviews I thought that buying it was a risk. IT IS A GREAT PRODUCT! Read the instructions to make sure you use it properly and don't expose sensitive parts to water. You need to move it slowly and methodically in the water, other than the trash disappearing only a slight vibration lets you know it is running. A 18' diameter pool is clean in 20-30 min and you are saving on the chemicals needed to keep the phosphates in line.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18' round Intex easy set pool. This vacuum does a good job. TWO IMPORTANT THINGS: 1. Always remember to keep USB port cover 100% closed when submerging it. 2. DON'T turn it on unless its underwater. The first time vacuuming this summer I had to empty the bags once during it but if you do it once a week, you don't have to empty the bag until your done. I cover my pool most nights so not much debris gets in there. I did have to sew a hole that occurred on the small white bag but it still does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: Small pool owner must have!!!!!!! 1st time pool owner we have a 15 ft round. This vacuum has saved the summer. My pool in under trees and is in full shade after 3 o’clock. I vacuum with this daily and it gets sand dirt pollen you name it up. My pool have never been cloudy. And never been green. And I get debris that falls in it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ammari

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It does suck up some of the algae, but its very slow going and after an hour you have to recharge and you have to make sure you use a lot of pressure to push in the charger on vacuum or it wont charge. Also after cleaning its very hard to put back the brush and if you don't it falls off. I wish I would have did more research for a better one
customer_reviews.author: Pan Dulce

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum but awful charging cord!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works well in vacuuming our 12 ft. above ground pool. We had previously only used a skimmer net to clean debris which was difficult to get debris off the pool floor. This has resolved that problem! The only major problem which is a pretty big one is that the charging cord does not stay in the plug on the vacuum. It is very, very loose and it seems as tho it is the wrong size for the vacuum . We have just fought with it which is a pain. Guess we should have returned it but for the cost to return we just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ann

customer_reviews.title: Will buy more when I need to .
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vacuume I bought two because the batteries don't last to long when your pool is to big, but with two you get the job done faster with help and they last long enough to clean the pool the only problem I had with this one is that the on & off switch its so tight it wont slide & its very hard to turn it off or on and I'm afraid it's going to break because it plastic . other then that Its Great.
customer_reviews.author: Vickilee67

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept however, extremely poor adaptation. Works for about 5 mins to pick up sand and very lite debris. Afterwards the small screen filter needs to be cleaned such that it works again. It is a low powered vacuum only good for a kiddy pool. Does not pick up small leaves (really small leaves). Need to find a way to turbo charge this and then it would be great!
customer_reviews.author: jacques voegtlen

customer_reviews.title: Suction ok but not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: Like that is lightweight and pretty easy to use, but doesn't stay charged long vs length of time takes to charge, thought usb charge would be convenient but would prefer a wall charger, the suction isn't all that great but ok and does clean, hard to remove vaccum from pool without spilling vacuumed water with dirt back into the pool because says not to turn on unless underwater, it's decent but if you want more power and charge you'd be better off to choose another vaccum.
customer_reviews.author: TAMRN1269

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a small pool vac to do spot cleaning in the pool without having to drag out the monster hose and then clean the filter.. This did the trick. Rechargeable and lasts about 20 minutes of continuous use. The only down side is that it is not as easy to clean out as she would have liked, NOT a deal breaker. She loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: This powerful little vacuum has been amazing for us this year! It doesn't do so well for large debris, but is very powerful against the conifer seeds that end up in your pool and shed everywhere on the bottom of your pool floor. That's what we use the vacuum for this year and we'll be swimming in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Kim J.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE SELLER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1
customer_reviews.text: We received this and it didn't work. The charger cable would not stay in the port of the hand held device. Pain in the neck to repack & return, Seller would only give partial refund-claimed it was inspected and worked fine!! Had to go through Amazon (who was great) for remainder of refund. DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: Charging problems on 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: I loved it but had to return 1st one because it would not charge at all. Customer service immediately replaced it and the second one worked wonderfully... until I tried to recharge it. The red light never comes on and I have made sure the voltage was high enough and left it for long time. It seemed to have suction for about 2 minutes and nothing. I have on charger again but have no light to show if it is charging. This would be great except for this issue
customer_reviews.author: san antonio peck

customer_reviews.title: Have to empty often
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works well. The BIG downside though is the collection bag. It’s small And I find myself having to constantly empty it before continuing. So in one cleaning of my 15’ round pool I have to empty the bag about 7 times which I find pretty inconvenient. It does pickup well though, Ilike the rechargeable battery, and the telescoping rod is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: invest
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pool for the last 6 years they are alot of up keep and work but I cant imagine not having one. I recently bought this vacuum and it works great. I absolutely live it. I was using the vacuum that connect to either the pump or water hose and the bag would always come off or something. I live that I dnt have to worry about that but also that it actually sucks up the small particles also. This was definitely a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little sucker!
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful for cleaning the small debris on the bottom of the pool. Handle length is great and easy to adjust. It charges quickly and holds the charge for up to 3 days or for more than an hour of use. I am very happy with this little sucker! If it lasts longer than a year I will be ecstatic.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dawla

customer_reviews.title: Awful!  Didnt get to use - Defective out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Read directions and attempted to charge. Power cord provided is too small. After playing around I was able to prop up the unit/power cord and it started charging. Left it alone all day until the battery light turned green. Turned it on and nothing. I know some may think that $150 isnt a lot to spend on a small pool vacuum but its a lot for me and I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Picture is after using it for two or three minutes. Easy to assemble and use. The micro filter bag works great, but is a little tricky to install over the other bag. FYI, it will only turn on once submerged. Will have to see how it holds up over time, but I consider it a good purchase for now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Was hopeful
customer_reviews.text: My vaccuum never worked. It never charged, it seemed like things were missing and I believe it was just completely broken. I’m not certain where this happened but it definitely was too much to happen in transit. It seems like it was returned that way. It look like tape had been ripped off of the broken part. Unfortunately I bought it at the end of summer 2 years ago and didn’t put out the pool last summer so this is my first time opening it after having it all this time. Quite disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient product
customer_reviews.text: I received this pool vacuum today and have used it once. Therefore, I can’t speak on long term durability. I would like to say that I am amazed and so happy with this product. It did an excellent job getting the leaves and debris from the bottom of the pool. I am 100% happy with this product and hope that it will continue to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this over a month ago and just now unboxed it to use. Very cheap made and will not charge so therefore will not work. Missed the window period to send it back so I'm stuck with lost unless the company will step up. More than likely Amazon will not post this review because anytime I have left a negative review they will not post it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Young

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and a great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum that does a very good job for our 18‘ x 4 1/2‘ above ground pool. Arrived quickly, well made. So much easier and more officiant then hooking up our pool pump vacuum. Have used it all summer and have no complaints. Wouldn’t recommend for big pools because vacuum is fairly small. We’re now on our 3rd summer with this little vacuum. Still does a great job. Battery and charger still work fine. We found out putting a knee hi hosiery over the screen filter helps catch more debris and particles. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DJ H

customer_reviews.title: Wow...It's better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought with doubt and thinking might have to return it since I have an inground pool...After the first use, I was sold. It worked better than I have expected. You have to apply the fine net that it included to trap all the fine algae that otherwise you couldn't get with a net. The battery lasts about 5 cleans before the next charge. Very good product! Hopefully, it can last more than a year...fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: TOKUSHI

customer_reviews.title: Works great until return window closes
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love thus thing it does a great job, better than anticipated..well had to change the rating and my opinion this item worked for approximately 2 weeks past the return window closed and quit working. I would not recommend buying it, as recall there was not a extended warranty offered for it and I guess I know why
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, just slowly
customer_reviews.text: It sucks, just fine. Go slow and steady. Its nothing like the vacuum that hooks to the filter but, it is easier to use and it does work. Slow and steady. We have a 22 above ground. I just start at one end and slowly work my way across my pool. I love it. Bought it last year, tgis year it stopped working. I called the 800 number and just recieved a replacement motor. Awesome service.
customer_reviews.author: ink-spot

customer_reviews.title: Second one ordered, both broke
customer_reviews.text: If this product wouldn’t break after a month and a half of use I would love it. I ordered one and it never worked out of the box. Got another one and after using it once a week since April, it stopped charging and won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Rameriz

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work - cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This product may be inexpensive (which is what attracted me to buy it), but it is poorly made and even though I gave it plenty of charge time, it would not power on. The bag is very small and the clear cover that attaches over the bag/filter does not easily go on once you put the filter bag on. I am returning this item and do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: Will not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I've used this 3 times and the thing is done for. Plugged in acts likes its charging and nothing when you place it in the water for vacuuming. So that's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Small Submersible Pool Vacuum Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient small pool vacuum. I have a 12 foot diameter Summer Waves above ground pool, and I can get over two10-15 minute continuous vacuums on a single charge! Device is made in China, but looks and feels very well made. It will suck-up pretty large chunks of dirt/grass that the kids Inevitably drag in. I was skeptical but so far so good. I will follow up in two months..........
customer_reviews.author: ScottR

customer_reviews.title: The part that sucks the water in won’t stay attached.
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the plastic piece on the top of the vacuum is very difficult. Most of the time, it won’t stay on. While I’m vacuuming, it falls off in the pool and everything I vacuumed falls back into the water. Terrible !! Returning item!! Don’t buy product! Wasted $50
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold charge
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it’s great. I texted sent wrong charger and still has not sent correct one, so cleaner does not hold a charge. I’ve used it twice, the first time it worked great fir almost an hour. The second time it lasted 5 minutes and died. Of course my return window closed 3 days ago. Hoping Intel comes through w/ new charger replacement but after a month it’s not looking very promising.
customer_reviews.author: SCMom

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING AND GET IT- TRUST ME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must. I asked amazon purchasers about how well it picks up debris and of course no real answers. It picks up pine needles, helicopter leaves and even really small pine cones. Amazing vacuum. BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun T.

customer_reviews.title: vacuum works ok
customer_reviews.text: i have a 10 ft round pool. this vacuum works real good at sucking up the dirt on the bottom. Takes me under 10 minutes to clean the pool bottom. the filters are easy to clean. i just remove them and spray them with water, then let dry. The charge on the vacuum is strong, i get 5 or 6 uses before i charge it up again. i use my battery jump backup device to recharge it.
customer_reviews.author: starcity

customer_reviews.title: Broken and still haven’t received a refund
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product expecting it to work great. It wouldn’t even turn on after it was charged. We’ve returned the item weeks ago and we still haven’t been refunded our money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Butler

customer_reviews.title: Does not last more than one season.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these. After the second one failed I decided to crack it open. I found that the sealed battery and motor unit were full of water. It only lasted one summer the next summer it worked for a day. That is same thing that happened to the first one that I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: N. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does work and removes the fine silt at the bottom of the hot tub. Other products I have had seemed to have more suction power than this one but I like the fact that it is easy to clean and has an on off switch as well as the rechargeable battery...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this thing. First of all, the charging cable would not stay inserted in the unit. It was loose. Then when I finally was able to use this vacuum, it was sooo slow. Took forever to suction the dirt from my pool. I packed it up and returned it. Got all my money back. Good concept, but poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Esther

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and broke within a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, but it's junk. On/Off switch broke within a month of purchasing. Netting still allows debris to go through, found that using a pantyhose piece worked better, or put coffee filters in, that helped. But with the switch breaking, what's the point? Spend more money and get something better (you could probably find something better, cheaper).
customer_reviews.author: HKG

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: No reason to hook up a vacuum hose to the suction side of pump and mess with the pole and attachment, this vacuum does it all. I have a small pool (25x12) and can get all the leaves, dirt, etc. in about 10-15 minutes of use. Just make sure you empty often while using if your pool is dirty because the larger leaves will get in the suction part and reduce the suction power.
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Great little Vacuum, Love that I don't need Hoses
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18' Foot and it takes me about a half hour to clean the whole pool. Sucks up pretty good and love that I don't need any hoses. It recharges with a USB power cord and charge lasts a while. My only complaint is I wish it had a bigger brush as well as the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: CRAPPY CUSTOMER SUPPORT TERRIBLE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! It worked for 2 weeks and then the pieces stopped fitting together, there are no accurate instructions on how to use the filter. INTEX DOES NOT HONOR THE REPLACEMENT WARRANTY, they only send out replacement parts. My vacuum has stopped working altogether, won’t charge or assemble properly and I’ve called the company three times about it.
customer_reviews.author: Morganiwatkins

customer_reviews.title: Good algae sucker
customer_reviews.text: This little vac worked like the description said. Would suck up the algae with the fine mesh filter with no problems. It was easy to charge. Yes, the on/off slider does stick when trying to turn on or off (annoying). It worked great for about three months then it fell and the button on the slider broke. I would purchase again just waiting for the price to go back down.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something for my portable hot tub. Other vacs I was thinking of cost way more so I decided to try this one. I love it. You do NOT get a charger just the charging cable which you use with a phone or any USB charger. you have 2 filters 1) is mesh for heavier debris and 2) is a microfiber for fine particles. The vac will not start until it is under water so the chance of burning it up is drastically reduced. I have been suing it for a couple months now and cannot be more pleased with how it has performed. Since it has an expandable handle it would work well in smaller pools.
customer_reviews.author: dalek56

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie to the pool world and installed a 52 x 26 ft above ground pool this summer. This little vacuum is by far the the best accessory I have purchased. I cannot imagine having to haul out hoses to vacuum. The battery lasts through 2-3 cleanings, then recharge. After cleaning you remove the mesh filter and rinse with the hose and reinstall. I have been using it 1 1/2 months but decided to write a review. I usually like to wait to write a review but I must recommend it now. 2 other pool owners have seen me use it and said they were going to order one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got the vacuum and plugged in the charger. The charger cord was loose and wouldn’t stay plugged into the vacuum. I had to wedge a piece of card board next to plug to keep it plugged in to vacuum. After a few hours I turned the switch on and nothing. Wouldn’t start. I’m in the process of returning it. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: noweaps

product_meta.title: Intex Handheld Rechargeable Vacuum with Telescoping Aluminum Shaft and Two Interchangeable Brush Heads , Gray/Black
product_meta.description: The rechargeable handheld vacuum from Intex makes maintenance & spot cleaning your pool or spa easier than ever. This convenient, portable, self-contained vacuum comes complete with everything you need for cleaning pools & spasup to 18' In diameter. This lightweight vacuum is easy-to-use & features an aluminum telescoping pole that is adjustableup to 94" In length with two interchangeable brush heads. The handheld vacuum is designed using strong, built-in Ni-MH rechargeable batteries to provide powerful suction capabilities. This built to last handheld vacuum includes an automatic shut-off feature to protect the vacuum from dry-running when not submerged in water & an IPX8 waterproof switch. The handheld vacuum from Intex even accommodates longer & wider telescoping aluminum poles using the included shaft adapter. The vacuum quickly recharges in approximately 50 Min using the included USB cable. Designed for use in Intex metal frame pools, ultra frame pools, EZ Set pools, purespas, & more. 94in lightweight telescoping aluminum shaft
feature_bullets: Strong, built-in Ni-MH rechargeable batteries for powerful suction capability
Suitable for use with all PureSpas and above ground pools up to 18' diameter
Includes two interchangeable brush heads, USB cable for recharging, 94" lightweight telesoping aluminum shaft, & shaft adapter to fit longer/wider telescoping aluminum shaft
Automatic shutoff feature when vacuum is not submerged in water, IPX8 waterproof switch for added protection against water submersion
Keep pool water clean by vacuuming out dirt and debris
Must be submerged to operate properly.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars2,575 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
